text: Shoemaking is about as quintessentially Maine as lobster or blueberries. I was proud to attend the opening of New Balance’s factory expansion in Skowhegan — a $65 million investment and testament to the skilled and dedicated workers across the state. https://t.co/WIEMVcByix

I want to wish my Jewish family and friends in Maine and across the world a sweet new year. This Rosh Hashanah, may you find peace, health and happiness.

Shanah Tovah Umetukah 🍎🍯

Thousands of Maine people rely on paper checks for Social Security, veterans benefits or tax refunds. We need a thoughtful transition, not a financial disruption. I’m urging the Administration to delay this change and protect all who rely on paper checks.
https://t.co/tTEJLmnwug

Secretary Kennedy preaches "radical transparency,” but blocking public input on our health policy doesn’t feel transparent — it feels dangerous.

This is a threat to public health and Congress needs to hold him accountable. https://t.co/Clhf6M4pbn

Only Congress holds the authority to change the name of federal departments. Full stop.

America hasn’t had a “Department of War” since WWII.  If you're talking about having been nominated to work for the Department of War, you're 78 years too late. https://t.co/i7k78POobQ

"An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure."

The National Falls Prevention Action plan from the @NCOAging will help older Americans reduce falls around the house that can be avoided by cost-effective investments to keep them healthy and standing strong! https://t.co/ANRPYzuN4S

Had fun visiting with @lauren_greennn to share some classic Maine fashion tips, as well as discuss the *tie* that binds our nation — the Constitution.

On Constitution Day, may we recognize this roadmap of American democracy and recommit to working toward a 'more perfect union.' https://t.co/sQuKbSftjo

Our national parks are “America’s Best Idea.” Senator @SteveDaines and I are working to protect them through the America the Beautiful Act so future generations can explore and enjoy their beauty, too. It’s time to invest in our public lands. https://t.co/jsk9mAKAWq

Hardworking Maine people shouldn’t pay more taxes than a billion-dollar company. The corporate alternative minimum tax was put in place to ensure the wealthiest corporations pay their fair share. This law should be strongly enforced, not weakened. https://t.co/9vhjfsjxmS

24 years ago, the September 11th terrorist attacks claimed nearly 3,000 innocent lives. Today, we honor the brave men & women we lost that day, as well as in the aftermath. As we reflect on this solemn anniversary, let's recommit to standing together in support of our democracy. https://t.co/XwxEwP045n

Political violence goes against the democratic values of our nation. This isn't about Democrats & Republicans. It's about protecting the ideals in our Constitution to peacefully assemble & exchange ideas. We can challenge each other's views without violence. It’s common sense.

Cyberthreats on are the rise as bad actors constantly look to exploit our digital weaknesses. Quality customer service shouldn't just be a private sector mindset; that's why I introduced the Improving Veteran’s Experience Act. Now that this law has passed and been signed into law, the VA will be better positioned to deliver top-notch service and support to our veterans. https://t.co/lYey4mHIMK

On Labor Day, we take a moment to honor the dignity of hardworking men & women across Maine & our country. As we celebrate with friends & family, let's remember those who helped build America, as well as the workforce of today striving for a stronger, more prosperous nation.

I often hear from Maine people about how workforce development, health care and cybersecurity are challenging their communities. The new Capital Center @UMAugusta is a powerful example of what happens when we invest in innovation and work together to meet 21st century needs. https://t.co/QG3AcQqjqm

Housing shortages in Maine and America are holding back growth and contributing to a higher cost-of living. I’m dedicated to finding creative, bipartisan solutions and prepared to work with anyone on either side of the aisle to address this critical need.
https://t.co/XrsOWXOLD9

Nearly 370K Maine people rely on Social Security, and millions nationwide. Since FDR signed it into law 90 years ago, these earned benefits have supported seniors, families and those with disabilities. I will work with any of my colleagues to protect this promise to Americans. https://t.co/6M5sB74sRp

Pulling $62M in congressionally-appropriated funding out from under the rug for Maine's 'Solar For All' program will ramp up energy costs for low-income Maine people and set us back in our goal for a more sustainable future. It's illegal, dumb and harmful.
https://t.co/l1DM3CtXxH

Cyberattacks and data breaches are on the rise — posing risk to Maine patients, their providers and hospitals. I'm ready to work with any of my colleagues to combat these threats and ensure our health care systems are prepared to defend against bad actors.
https://t.co/UImDnqlrTK

Purple Heart recipients are patriots who put themselves in harms’ way to defend our country and their fellow servicemembers — some paying the ultimate price. Today, we honor and thank these brave men and women for their extraordinary courage and sacrifice. #PurpleHeartDay

60 years ago today, the #VotingRightsAct enacted a basic set of protections securing the right to vote for *all* Americans. Today, we have an obligation to protect the foundation of our democracy by ensuring every eligible American can make their voice heard at the ballot box. https://t.co/a6DPp0dhGK

I took "that should be a postcard" seriously... 😉📸🏞️

https://t.co/PrZn3wHTL2

This is exciting news for Maine, the hardworking men and women at @GDBIW, and for our country's national security. I'm proud to see our state leading the way in helping our military protect and defend us both at home and abroad.

Bath Built is Best Built!

https://t.co/Jhb3dLw4Nk

Since 1965, Medicaid & Medicare have been lifelines for millions. However, the tax bill pushed through earlier this month slashed these critical programs.

Today, as we recognize 60 years, we must recommit to restoring access to care & keeping our fellow Americans healthy & safe. https://t.co/xSDinoAxig
Join me for a 'Day in the Life' as a U.S. Senator from Maine. https://t.co/A2Qs0AZZqs

I always enjoy the energy of the @NationalParkFdn team as they advocate for our parks and public lands — America’s Best Idea. Together, we’re working together to restore the Legacy Restoration Fund and help preserve our treasured lands for generations to come. https://t.co/HrPo4oV6w7

Our global reach doing good in other countries is what makes our nation great, but slashing USAID and downgrading the State Department gives power to China and Russia. Now, our military will have to take on the added responsibility of acting as diplomats in critical regions. https://t.co/AZvAO1rCf0

Requiring the Interior Secretary to personally review every wind and solar permit proposal won't help lower energy prices or supercharge our power supply. It's short-sighted, inefficient bureaucracy that will stall American energy.

Every Maine person deserves access to drinking water without worrying about dangerous toxins. This spring, I introduced a bipartisan bill to address PFAS in water systems and private wells, and protect Americans from dangerous "forever chemicals."
https://t.co/nbBRmFfEBJ

Maine has been battling Lyme disease for decades. By reauthorizing the bipartisan Kay Hagan Tick Act, we can keep fighting this disease by funding critical research & testing. It’s one small way we can work together to keep Maine people safe & healthy. https://t.co/NL8ySjJggl

From the March on Washington to crossing the Edmund Pettus Bridge to the House of Representatives, John Lewis’ fight for civil rights embodied the best of our nation. Today, we honor his legacy by getting into #GoodTrouble & continuing his work toward a more just, equal society. https://t.co/9CC6u4vqg8

Three years ago, Congress came together on a bipartisan basis to create a three-digit crisis hotline.

Today, the #988Lifeline has helped save lives by guiding Maine people through mental health emergencies. If you need help, support is available 24/7 by calling or texting 988. https://t.co/4jIwOGLIWQ

The annual National Defense Authorization Act makes important investments that enables Maine people and businesses to play a critical role in the safety and security of our nation.

The "power of the purse" is granted solely to Congress in the Constitution. However, we're handing over our own power as we continue to allow the Executive Branch to substitute its agenda for Congress' role.

It's dangerous and sets a harmful precedent for our nation's future. https://t.co/oWhHqkmiWe

"When the legislative and executive powers are united in the same person or body...there can be no liberty..." - James Madison, Federalist Papers 47

I'm on my way to the floor to speak on the rescissions package and the further abdication of Congress' power. Tune in if you can!

When the Founding Fathers signed the Declaration of Independence, they made a promise to fight for our nation's freedom and pursue a more perfect union. On#IndependenceDay, we celebrate their courage & recommit to upholding the values of our democracy.
 
Happy 4th of July, Maine! https://t.co/oLxzGwerAX
Never have so many been so grievously hurt in the service of so few. https://t.co/ZjtHZMYbiH

This bill is literally taking food out of the mouths of children to give tax breaks to millionaires. It's wrong and it's immoral.

I'm urging all my colleagues to vote no so we can start over and work together to deliver a responsible, bipartisan spending bill. https://t.co/rqh08YHTtj

Ahead of the overnight votes, I wanted to share my worries for Maine with this bill:

⚕️ ~60K people without health insurance
🍎 ~30K people losing all or part of their SNAP benefits
📈 3T+ added to the U.S. debt
➕ So much more

This bill isn't just irresponsible, it's cruel. https://t.co/5SlIGx2OCJ

Looking out for one another is what we do best here in Maine — my friend and Lewiston native Patrick Dempsey agrees.

On June 19, 1865, the last slaves in Galveston, Texas rejoiced as they received word of their freedom. 160 years later, we recognize #Juneteenth as a celebration of their strength, resiliency and dreams, and recommit ourselves to working toward a more just and fair society.

Renaming military bases away from confederate soldiers’ names wasn't to erase history, it was to acknowledge our mistakes as we pursue a "more perfect union." The National Park Service is already underfunded and understaffed. To put its budget on the chopping block as we continue to see a rise in visitors at parks across the county is reckless and thoughtless.

It's the worst idea for "America's Best Idea." https://t.co/Nhfb4n9seK

But the best I've gotten is an incomplete list riddled with errors. It's unacceptable and an insult to our veterans. https://t.co/P4bGivobkk

"It's high time we stopped thinking politically...and started thinking patriotically as Americans."

These words, spoken by Maine Senator Margaret Chase Smith, ring just as true 75 years later. Today, I declare it’s high time we put aside partisanship and stand up for democracy. https://t.co/O3Z0mb6ooJ

In honor of Memorial Day, I sat down with Navy Vietnam War veteran Richard L'Heureux. His story of courageous service is now a part of the @librarycongress Veterans History Project where it will serve as inspiration for future generations.

The @101starw is a Maine success story — providing critical refueling support for our military at home and abroad. I'm proud the MAINEiacs are a finalist for the new KC-46As and will continue to advocate on behalf of their essential mission.
https://t.co/SaHheIacl6

Last night’s murders at the Capitol Jewish Museum in Washington, D.C. are the latest act of despicable antisemitism and hate directed towards the Jewish community.

I pray for the Jewish community and recommit to the security and safety of the Jewish people all across the world.

I enjoyed sitting down with General Eric Smith, Commandant of the @USMC, and talking about how Congress can better support the brave Marines who serve our nation at home and abroad. #SemperFi https://t.co/CkQxjqM1pb

A life of public service can take many forms — whether it’s volunteering, contributing to your community or elected office. Every Maine person has the opportunity to stand up for what’s right, fight injustice and spread hope. https://t.co/wek82ARVCA

History warns us that there may come a time when the pendulum swings and the unchecked power you actively installed or passively enabled could point back at you. We must restore our system of checks and balances to protect the American people and our democracy. https://t.co/o5WeZ4zx18

Margaret Chase Smith’s words ring more true — and urgent — today than when she first spoke them. Americans should put aside politics and return to what unites us: the Constitution. COMING UP: I'm heading to the floor to update Senator Margaret Chase Smith's ‘Declaration of Conscience’ speech, and call on my colleagues to stand up to the unprecedented constitutional crisis our nation faces.

Maine Republican Senator Margaret Chase Smith delivered her 'Declaration of Conscience' 75 years ago, speaking about a nation in crisis. It's dangerous for senior national security officials to be so reckless with sensitive information & we deserve a thorough explanation as to how this breach happened. https://t.co/CzoFOUT13B

Let's call this what it was: a breach of security. https://t.co/z0b9FRmuzY

Social security payments — relied on by so many Americans for food, rent and medicine — are under attack.

Like a lot of the folks I talk to in Maine, Brad shared his concerns about DOGE.

Article 1 states federal spending allocations are made in the Congress — not by employees of an unelected tech-tycoon. We can disagree on policy, but we should all agree on the Constitution. https://t.co/DwgNRO2xu3

I'm answering calls from Maine people to hear their thoughts on everything from the cuts at the VA to the ongoing discussions surrounding the FY25 spending bill.

A new wave of thousands of VA firings would only make it more difficult for veterans to access their hard-earned benefits. If there’s no one there to answer the phone when a veteran calls, that’s the same as being turned away at the door. https://t.co/I87p2jT6lO

When you become a member of Congress, you take an oath to the Constitution, not to the president.

You've probably seen some of the presidential cabinet nomination hearings on TV. It's the Senate's Constitutional duty to 'advise and consent' to the nominees.

I thought I’d share a few thoughts on this important process before I head to a nomination hearing. ⬇️ https://t.co/EoJwJjkER3

My approach to cabinet nominees boils down to two priorities:

🔹Relevant experience & qualifications
🔹Not having a stance hostile to the agency they would be leading

I joined @CNN to share my thoughts as the Senate begins hearings to fulfill our duty to advise and consent. ⬇️ https://t.co/oMt6gRBZMJ

📺 COMING UP: Ahead of the presidential cabinet nominee hearings, I'm joining @CNN to discuss my approach to the nomination process, not only as a senator with an 'advice and consent' role, but as a former governor, too.

Grab a cup of ☕️ and tune in at ~7:45 AM ET.

As a former governor, I know how important it is for the chief executive to pick their team. As we work through cabinet nomination hearings, my job is to determine if the President-elect's nominees are qualified to lead a federal agency.

Read more here ⬇️
